lines.text: [Tied up so he won't hurt anyone]
Wait, Kelly, I forgot to take my clothes off! I can see this turn of events is going to play hell on my wardrobe budget...
I don't want to be like this!
Then kill yourself. That's the way a werewolf dies. By his own hand, or by a silver bullet, or by another we-- Did you come to kill me?
But not tonight, you don't. Because tonight, we hunt.
Maybe you should call your lawyer.
And tell him what, I'm going werewolf hunting? They'd lock me in a rubber room with a box of Crayolas.

those who believe in flying saucers, and those who don't. I've never been one much for believing in anything I couldn't wrap my hands around and shake... but then, up 'til two weeks ago, I didn't know Eric Cord.
I'm no longer in control. I could hurt *anyone* now. You. Kelly. Anyone. And I'm afraid I won't care.
When I knew what was happening, I used to try to keep myself locked up...but then I stopped.
Locking myself up. I didn't *want* to anymore. Even before I'd change, I knew I was going to...and I wanted it.
The only thing worse than a nightmare is a nightmare that you can't wake up from.
When the world isn't the same as our minds believe, then we are in a nightmare. And nothing is worse than a nightmare... except for one you can't wake up from.
[When the world isn't the same as our minds believe, then we are in a nightmare. And nothing is worse then a nightmare, except one you can't wake up from]
When the world isn't the same as our minds believe, then we are in a nightmare. And nothing is worse then a nightmare, except one you can't wake up from.
